title.rendered: New Zealand vs India, 3rd ODI: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Probable XI for New Zealand: Finn Allen, Devon Conway, Kane Williamson (c), Daryl Mitchell, Tom Latham (wk), Glenn Phillips, Mitchell Santner, Michael Bracewell, Matt Henry, Tim Southee, Lockie Ferguson

Probable XI for India: Shikhar Dhawan (c), Shubman Gill, Shreyas Iyer, Rishabh Pant (wk), Suryakumar Yadav, Deepak Hooda, Washington Sundar, Deepak Chahar, Umran Malik, Arshdeep Singh, Yuzvendra Chahal

Pitch Report

Venue: Hagley Oval, Christchurch

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 240

2nd innings average score: 241

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Decent batting wicket.

Weather: Showers forecast.

Wins

Batting 1st: —

Batting 2nd: 100%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

At least one century has been scored by a batter in the last three ODIs at the Hagley Oval.

New Zealand have a formidable record at the venue, having won 8 of the last 9 ODIs.

Dew is expected to make its presence felt as the match progresses. Spinners will have their work cut out.

Smart Picks

All eyes will be on Tom Latham, who arguably played the best ODI innings (145) of his career at Auckland. Furthermore, when he last batted at the Hagley Oval in the format, he scored 110 off 108 balls.

Kane Williamson was also a part of the Ultimate Team for registering 94* at Auckland. At Christchurch, he has slammed 3 half-centuries in 7 ODIs.

Lockie Ferguson and Tim Southee bagged 3 wickets each in the opening game of the series. For the year, they have picked 23 wickets between them.

Shreyas Iyer has been India’s best batter in ODIs this year. In his last 10 innings, he has accumulated 549 runs at 69, including one hundred and 5 half-centuries.

After being dismissed for a single-digit score in the first ODI, Suryakumar Yadav responded with a breezy 34* in the second game. Given his recent form and the confidence with which he has striking th ball, one can expect a bunch of handy points from him.

Shubman Gill has already added 95 runs in the first two games. In fact, he has been a part of the Ultimate Team for the last 3 ODIs.

Although Shikhar Dhawan has been mostly playing second fiddle to Shubman Gill, he has kept the fantasy players happy through consistent run-making. He has registered 3 half-centuries in his last 7 ODIs against the Kiwis.
